# Xi Jinping’s purge of China's top general spells uncertainty for world’s largest military

China's highest-ranked military general’s purge leaves President Xi Jinping almost alone at the helm of the military. Despite no one knowing for sure what led to this latest crackdown, there's a lot of speculation about what it means for the biggest army in the world.

## Departure of Zhang Youxia, accused of corruption, raises questions about Taiwan

[Lisa Xing](https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/author/lisa-xing-1.4128165) · CBC News · Posted: Jan 31, 2026 4:00 AM EST \| Last Updated: January 31

![Uniformed military offices march in a parade holding their weapons.](https://i.cbc.ca/ais/48870c59-60c2-4e29-94ed-1046149f58a7,1769805067133/full/max/0/default.jpg?im=Crop%2Crect%3D%280%2C287%2C5500%2C3093%29%3B)

Members of the Chinese People's Liberation Army air force march during a military parade to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the Second World War, in Beijing on Sept. 3, 2025.(Maxim Shemetov/Reuters)

The surprise ousting of China's highest-ranked general has the world's largest military in turmoil and leaves the future of the Central Military Commission uncertain following years of Chinese President Xi Jinping's sweeping purges.

The ensuing investigation into Zhang Youxia — who was vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission (CMC), the military body that oversees the People's Liberation Army (PLA) with its two million personnel — leaves Xi almost alone at the helm of the military.
